intro: Metcalfia compacta, commonly known as the compact metcalfia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. The flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
